reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great PNR debut
reviews.reviewText: Wow ….This book does not disappoint. Not sure what I was expecting but was not ready for this. I have not read anything similar. Loved watching the development of Colby as he learns his past & become the Warlock he is meant to be…. The steam & growth between Colby & Lexie is amazing.I do have to stay please read the trigger warning.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great debut novel
reviews.reviewText: I the relationship between Colby and Lexie is wonderful. Its actually my first reading an established relationship.I absolutely loved how Colby didn't immediately jump head first in to his family's grimoire. He/they looked at it with caution (definitely something I would do if I was in that situation)I book binge if I really enjoy it, was a great one sitting read made me laugh and feel warmed heartedI look forward to seeing more of Colby and Lexie

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I loved this book!!! I'm usually not a huge fan of fantasy but it was sooooooo good! I loved how it was still super realistic in every day to day life! I loved the married couple and how they explored their sexual limits! Super hot!!! Highly recommend!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great PRN debut novel
reviews.reviewText: This is very different from everything I’ve ever read before. I haven’t really read a ton of PRN and I don’t normally read 3rd person. But this story pulled me in and kept me until the book was finished. Colby and Lexie’s story was interesting, fun, steamy, sweet and so cool to see them grown not only as a couple but to see Colby come into his warlock powers.I loved their openness to the supernatural world. Colby loved becoming warlock and Lexie accepted every aspect of this new world. I loved getting to see a variety of supernatural creatures including witches, werewolves and of course a ghost.I don’t want do give away too much but I absolutely loved how Colby and Lexie explored their relationship as a married couple and found what they were interested in together. It felt very relatable.I loved that the story and secrets unfolded throughout the book and the friendships and found family Colby and Lexie find within the Super natural community.Colby and Lexie experience ups and downs, challenges and tribulations but through it they rely on each other. There’s action, magic, and a great found family.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Easy going fantasy read
reviews.reviewText: This story was easy and fun. Nice basic fantasy on characters as well as premise but liked that the relationship between Colby and his wife was so equal and loving as well as open minded.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Woah!! Now this is the book that will make you laugh, cry, love, get angry, and all things....then do it all over again!Lexie and Colby have an incredible marriage, and the little spitfire dialog between each other is awesome. They're fixing up their old house together and learning of long lost secrets...Colby...has magic in his blood, which also means he has a "sexy wand," 😉 but he didn't know about this part of his history until discovering those secrets held within the walls of their home.Along their journey, they meet some amazing people and some not so great people. The instances that they have to encounter will make you want to reach through the pages and just hug them!I absolutely love Colby, Lexie, and Malik! I won't spoil who Malik is because you'll want to read to find out! But I promise you won't be disappointed! 😉If you're a fan of werewolves, vampires, witches, warlocks, and all things related, be sure to check this one out!!! 🖤BJ Wolff, you did an AMAZING job with your debut novel, and I am so incredibly excited for what's next to come!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good Debut Novel, Cute Story
reviews.reviewText: I did not hate this book, it was just really difficult for me to get into. First, it is written in third person, which is not my favorite style of writing. After a few chapters, I can generally acclimate to third person and proceed to enjoy the book. The entire time I was reading Warlock: A Strange Grove Novel, it felt like there was a sport commentator in my head giving me a play by play with what was happening in the book. This made for some very interesting moments in the plot for me, and also caused me to take several breaks while reading, which is not my normal. There are a lot of pop culture references in this book, maybe too many, however at times it gave for a humorous inner dialog for Colby, the main male characters. Colby and Lexie are a sugary sweet couple and very likeable main characters. I also found the supporting characters to be very interesting. This was a cute story, several times I felt like the spicy scenes should have been left out and this made a cozy paranormal romance.Overall this is a cute, and enjoyable story. This would be a nice leisurely read for anyone that likes witch and warlock romance books.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars First male author I've read in a genre like this...
reviews.reviewText: This book turned out to be a fun ride. Who doesn't love crossing that line between reality and fantasy, where the book starts out in complete reality only to push you headfirst into a different world, one that still feels real and believable? It was really fun to see the development of the male lead as he learned all about himself and his history! The relationship with his wife was both sweet and extra spicy, creating a fun romp that really stepped a bit into a different zone that I wasn't prepared for, but kind of grew on me. I wasn't sure about a male author in this genre, but heck, this was totally enjoyable, and completely unexpected. All in all, I really enjoyed it, and I will be looking for more work from BJ Wolff!
